page.title: 07LIFESTYLES_ THE TENNANT ARMS
page.content:
The hotel (first the{Fife Arms}after the{Earls of Fife}who owned local {Innes House}and now named after its present owners the{Tennants}) has ser_ ved{Lhanbryde}for over{150 years}. It was,then,a{coaching inn}_ as the wide archway round the main door shows.
The present owners,John and Aileen Bryce refurbished the lounge with blue velvet and Jacobean furniture in 1983 & in 1985 the old public bar and cel_ lars were{converted}into the'Coachman Suite' (a large dining room with bar, lounge area and ballroom,furnished in grey and red velvet from France).
The Bryce's son David is the chef and this popular hotel serves bar lun_ ches,high teas,dinners and bar suppers daily.There are monthly dinner_dances for the over 25s.
